SENT.plain: We describe a patient with acute myeloid leukemia (AML) occurring 5 years after successful treatment of severe aplastic anemia (SAA) with antilymphocyte globulin (ALG)
Four years after ALG, SAA had relapsed
A second remission of SAA was achieved, but was followed by transformation of the myelodysplastic syndrome into overt AML
After 2 courses of high-dose cytosine arabinoside and VP-16 complete remission occurred
This case shows that chemotherapy of secondary leukemia after SAA is feasible, and that ex-aplastic bone marrow is capable of complete recovery from chemotherapy-induced aplasia
Morphological anomalies of bone marrow noticed early during remission of SAA might predict a late transformation in leukemia
